jojo pose.title: JoJo Pose
jojo pose.description: Exaggerated, dramatic stances used by characters in *JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure*. These poses are so stylized and frequent they've become a meme and a symbol of anime flamboyance.

it's over 9000.title: It's Over 9000!
it's over 9000.description: A legendary meme from *Dragon Ball Z*, where Vegeta reacts to Goku's power level. The phrase symbolizes extreme power and is one of the most iconic lines in anime history.

chekhov's gun.title: Chekhov's Gun
chekhov's gun.description: A storytelling principle that states every element introduced must serve a purpose. If a gun is shown in Act 1, it must be fired by Act 3. Common in tightly-written thrillers and anime.

nakama.title: Nakama
nakama.description: A Japanese word meaning 'comrade' or 'close companion', famously used in *One Piece*. It's loaded with emotional weight and signifies deep loyalty and chosen family.

the cake is a lie.title: The Cake is a Lie
the cake is a lie.description: A cryptic phrase from the game *Portal* that became a meme. It's a metaphor for false promises — often used in pop culture commentary and dark humor.

train scene.title: Anime Train Scene
train scene.description: Common in anime — characters on a train, often reflecting on life or watching scenery fly by. Symbolizes movement, change, or emotional turning points.

power of friendship.title: Power of Friendship
power of friendship.description: A classic anime trope where emotional bonds between characters become literal sources of strength. Often used in climactic fights where love and loyalty overcome power.

you are already dead.title: Omae wa mou shindeiru
you are already dead.description: From *Fist of the North Star*. The phrase means 'You are already dead', usually said before the enemy realizes they've been struck. It became a viral anime meme with the reply 'NANI?!'

he's just like me fr.title: He's Just Like Me fr
he's just like me fr.description: A meme where someone sees a tragic, edgy, or misunderstood character and relates deeply, often ironically. Popular on anime TikTok and edits.

screaming in the rain.title: Screaming in the Rain
screaming in the rain.description: A dramatic moment in many anime and live-action shows where a character has an emotional breakdown — often screaming while it's raining. Peak drama energy.

trauma haircut.title: Trauma Haircut
trauma haircut.description: Seen in countless dramas and movies — a character cuts their hair after a breakup, loss, or identity crisis. Symbolizes emotional rebirth or taking control.

i'm not like other girls.title: I'm Not Like Other Girls
i'm not like other girls.description: A self-aware or sometimes cringe trope where a female character distinguishes herself from others, often through quirky habits or ‘tomboy’ vibes. Common in rom-coms and early 2000s YA.

you dropped this 👑.title: You Dropped This 👑
you dropped this 👑.description: A viral phrase used to praise someone for saying or doing something admirable, often ironically. The crown emoji adds a playful sense of royalty or iconic status.

do revenge.title: Do Revenge
do revenge.description: From the Netflix film *Do Revenge* — a Gen Z homage to high school revenge thrillers. The title itself became a meme for chaotic, stylish payback energy.

slow zoom in on crying.title: Slow Zoom Crying Shot
slow zoom in on crying.description: A dramatic cinematography trick used in K-dramas and thrillers — the camera slowly zooms in on a crying character's face to emphasize emotional collapse.

gaslight gatekeep girlboss.title: Gaslight, Gatekeep, Girlboss
gaslight gatekeep girlboss.description: An ironic remix of toxic behaviors turned empowerment slogan. Originally meant to mock corporate feminism, but now used both seriously and sarcastically online.

kdrama umbrella scene.title: K-drama Umbrella Scene
kdrama umbrella scene.description: A romantic K-drama staple: One character gently offers their umbrella to another in the rain. Used to symbolize tenderness, protection, and *just kiss already* energy.

crying in the club.title: Crying in the Club
crying in the club.description: Used ironically to describe emotional breakdowns in fun or inappropriate places. Often paired with party scenes, anime OPs, or emotional edits.

villain with a point.title: Villain With a Point
villain with a point.description: A character who is technically the antagonist — but whose ideology is *just relatable enough* to make you question your morals. Think Killmonger, Light Yagami, or Thanos.

dead wife motivation.title: Dead Wife Motivation
dead wife motivation.description: A common character backstory where a male protagonist is driven by the tragic loss of a wife or lover. Often lazy writing — see John Wick, Gladiator, etc.

i want to be hokage.title: I Want to Be Hokage
i want to be hokage.description: From *Naruto*. Naruto Uzumaki's lifelong goal is to become Hokage — the strongest ninja and leader of his village. It’s the ultimate underdog dream turned anime staple.

plus ultra.title: Plus Ultra
plus ultra.description: The motto of *My Hero Academia*. It means to go 'beyond the limits' — shouted by characters when pushing past their breaking point. Literal shounen energy.

bankai.title: Bankai
bankai.description: From *Bleach*. The final, ultimate release of a Soul Reaper’s sword — unleashing massive power and a new form. Usually shouted before epic battles.

i see you're a man of culture as well.title: I See You're a Man of Culture as Well
i see you're a man of culture as well.description: A respectful nod among anime or niche fans recognizing shared taste. Originated from *Arakawa Under the Bridge*, now used widely online.

za warudo.title: ZA WARUDO!
za warudo.description: From *JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure*. Dio screams this before stopping time using his Stand, The World. Often followed by 'TOKI WO TOMARE!' ('Time, stop!')

the world.title: THE WORLD!
the world.description: From *JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure*. Dio screams this before stopping time using his Stand, The World. Often followed by 'TOKI WO TOMARE!' ('Time, stop!')

nani?!.title: NANI?!
nani?!.description: Japanese for 'what?!'. Became a meme from *Fist of the North Star* in response to 'Omae wa mou shindeiru'. Delivered with shock and terror.

don't lose your way.title: Don't Lose Your Way
don't lose your way.description: Iconic lyric from *Kill la Kill*’s soundtrack that plays during fight scenes. Fans meme it as a hype boost for chaotic or emotional moments.

you are not alone.title: You Are Not Alone
you are not alone.description: From *Neon Genesis Evangelion*. Repeated throughout the series and its film titles. Used to convey human connection and isolation — heavily meme’d and parodied.

shut up megumi.title: Shut Up, Megumi
shut up megumi.description: From *Konosuba*. Kazuma yelling at Megumi for her obsession with explosion magic. Became a running joke about party dysfunction and anime chaos.

sharingan.title: Sharingan
sharingan.description: A special eye technique in *Naruto* used by the Uchiha clan. Grants perception, illusion abilities, and later evolves into forms like Mangekyō Sharingan.

grab a potato chip and eat it.title: I'll Take a Potato Chip... and Eat It!
grab a potato chip and eat it.description: From *Death Note*. A wildly overdramatic scene where Light Yagami monologues about eating chips while writing in the Death Note — peak anime drama meme.

that wasn't very plus ultra of you.title: That Wasn't Very Plus Ultra of You
that wasn't very plus ultra of you.description: A sarcastic meme remix of *My Hero Academia*’s slogan. Used when someone fails to live up to shounen ideals or acts shady.

anime betrayal.title: Top 10 Anime Betrayals
anime betrayal.description: A meme format started by WatchMojo’s iconic YouTube list. Now used sarcastically when someone gets backstabbed or called out online.

yare yare daze.title: Yare Yare Daze
yare yare daze.description: Signature catchphrase of Jotaro Kujo from *JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure*. Loosely translates to 'good grief' or 'here we go again'. JoJo fans say it constantly.
